Description: The Virgin and Christ Child seated in the centre surrounded by saints, St Martha at the left, St Antony and the Magdalene above and St Antony at the right, after Camillo Boccaccino. after 1546 Chiaroscuro woodcut from three blocks in brown
Curator's comments: Despite the initials 'F.P.' on the block, this woodcut was in fact after a design by Camillo Boccaccino. The connection with an oil sketch by him in the Uffizi was recognised by A.E.Popham in 1971. See Naoko Takahatake, 'The chiaroscuro woodcut in Renaissance Italy', Los Angeles 2018, cat.54, who dates it after 1546. This is one of two impressions of the print in the BM, both of which were printed in Vicentino's workshop.
Associated names: Representation of: St Antony of Egypt
Previous owner: Previous owner/ex-collection: Thomas Howard, 14th Earl of Arundel
Acquisition notes: On the recto is stamped twice a six-pointed star (similar but not the same as the Lanier mark, Lugt 2885, 2886, and much larger than L.2898). On the verso in ink in a XVIIc hand 'E collectione Arundeliana'. In another hand 'no 25 fol.' Thane's ownership might be before or after Barnard's.
